info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 5:18PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Snow showers with embedded snow squalls may impact northeastern New York and Vermont... Snow squalls are possible this evening in the heaviest showers as a cold front moves across Vermont. Affected locations will see rapidly changing weather and road conditions with brief heavy snow and gusty winds. Visibilities below 1 mile are expected and possibly below a half mile in rare instances. A quick accumulation of snow up to an inch is possible. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Be prepared for areas of blowing and drifting snow. This could lead to temporary whiteout conditions and the potential for dangerous driving conditions. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations.
